title.rendered: Instagram joins the trend of NFTs

content.rendered:
Before we start talking about the arrival of the NFTs to Instagram It is important to briefly explain the meaning of this term that is so new and so widely heard today.

Its acronym translates as “Non-Fungible Token”, that is, an NFT is a non-expendable good.

But what is this non-expendable good? To understand it, it is differentiate between expendable and non-expendable property.

The expendable goods are those products that consume with their use, but they can be to exchange by others, since their properties are practically the same. For example, you can exchange a pencil for another of the same characteristics.

The non-expendable property They are that they are not consumedbut not They may be substituted for others exactly the same. For example, a work of art.

An NFT is a unique asset that cannot be exchanged for another of the same value

NFTs work through technology blockchain either block chain. Each block is linked with a previous block and, thus, each NFT has a digital certificate of authenticitythat is, a set of metadata that will be impossible to modify.

NFTs on Instagram

The idea of ​​integrating NFTs into the platform is not recent, as it had already been mentioned by the CEO of the social network, Adam Mosseri.

Now, everything seems to indicate that Meta has already taken the decision to adapt this format to the platform.

During the “South by Southwest Festival”, event held in the city of Austin, Texas and related to technology, film and music worldwide, Mark Zuckerberg confirmed the arrival of the NFTs to Instagram in the short term.

He has also discussed the possibility that these NFTs play a key role in the metaverse that the company is devising.

Thus, the NFTs you buy on their platforms can become functional inside your virtual world. For example, that the clothes your avatar wears in the metaverse can be coined as an NFT and carried anywhere.

However, he has not given too many details, although he has made it clear that the integration of non-fungible tokens in Instagram is in development phase, although some technical details still need to be polished.

Criticism of NFTs

Much of the criticism is due to the fact that they are part of a unregulated markettherefore, the prices of each token can vary constantly and even cost arbitrary amounts.

It is the people themselves who assign them a worth and those who are willing to pay it based on their own interest.

Other social networks with NFT

NFTs are getting more and more popularity and Meta is not the only company interested in including them in their social networks.

Twitter has recently activated the use of NFT images. If you are a user of Twitter Blue (premium version) you can now show the NFTs you want in the profile picture. To differentiate them from the usual ones, the platform has shaped hexagonal.

Youtube has also shown interest in NFTs. Video creators will be able to offer their content as NFTs so that those interested in them can acquire those unique experiences and achieve a greater reach of audiences.

The confidence of the digital giants towards this format is relevant And it’s spreading across the board.
